title.narrative: SSC on Sustainable and Smart Cities between the City of Aarhus (DK) and the City of Tshwane (South Africa)

description.narrative:
Strategic Sector Cooperation on Sustainable and Smart Cities Between Denmark and South Africa, Phase I
The Strategic Sector Cooperation on health is a peer-to-peer cooperation between between Aarhus Municipality and the City of Tshwane. The objective of the Strategic Sector Cooperation is to introduce principles of integrated sustainable development and smart cities in South Africa by upgrading of Salvokop districts tools and guidelines through peer-to-peer cooperation. South African cities struggling with high degree of segregation between poor and wealthy communities, inner cities characterised by decay and safety problems due to crime and a infrastructure favoring cars resulting in poor conditions for pedestrians and bicycles.
The cooperation aims to improve the technical capacity of Tswane municipality in relation to inegrated urban planning and development of safe and inclusive neighborhoods based on mixed-use principles and with special emphasis on promotion of non-motorised traffic, improved water and storm water management, safe public spaces and improved water supply.The government of Tswane City is highly committed to use the city as a showcase and a experimentarium for sustainable development, which can be replicated in other cities later on.
